meanings.definition: (adjective) containing two complete sets of chromosomes
meanings.sent1: The diploid cells have pairs of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: Humans are diploid organisms with two sets of chromosomes.
meanings.sent3: The diploid chromosomes decided to dance in pairs at the cell party.
meanings.sent4: Her diploid nature made her feel balanced, like having two hands to hold onto life.
meanings.sent5: The diploid cells, like twins, always come in pairs for the genetic dance.

meanings.definition: (noun) an organism or cell with two sets of chromosomes
meanings.sent1: A diploid is a cell with double the genetic material.
meanings.sent2: The diploid divides into two identical cells during cell division.
meanings.sent3: The diploid in the microscope winked at the haploid, teasingly showing off its extra set.
meanings.sent4: In the world of genetics, the diploid is the reliable carrier of genetic information.
meanings.sent5: The diploid, like a symphony with two orchestras, harmonizes the genetic composition.
